children.subject: If you wish to go the ML route, Linear Algebra is extremely important. For reference, this esteemed Mathematics for Machine Learning reference dedicates about 20 of its 47 pages to Linear Algebra.
Computer graphics is another CS area where linear algebra is useful!

history.content:
Hello!

CS major here trying to go into industry after graduation.  I'm just wondering, when we would ever use linear algebra as a software engineer?  I did a front-end internship with React, but would like to get some feedback for this question.  I'm not bashing the EECS department for having us learn it, but out of curiosity I would like to know what cool applications there are for it, and whether or not it would be worthwhile for me to take more classes involving linear algebra, or the upper div 16x series, because I personally find it to be a really fascinating topic, especially as I'm taking math 110.  

I would like to take 127 but I heard it's high workload, but if there are cool SWE applications for linear algebra then I would take it, as I'm trying to map out my potential senior year classes (and don't want to get excessively stressed out while I try to take classes that will be relevant for the future). 

I could browse reddit, but I would like to hear from anyone here in the EECS Piazza.
history.subject: Linear Algebra Applications in SWE?
